title: /worker start command not actually polling Work Queue
context:
BUG REPORT: The /worker start command in Telegram claims to start polling the Work Queue every 2 minutes but does not actually function.

SYMPTOMS:
- Command responds with success message in Telegram UI
- Claims polling is enabled every 2 minutes
- No actual Work Queue polling occurs
- Worker remains inactive despite "started" status

EXPECTED BEHAVIOR:
- /worker start should initiate actual Work Queue polling
- Should check queue every 2 minutes as advertised
- Should process available tasks automatically
- Should provide real status feedback

DEBUGGING NEEDED:
- Verify polling loop implementation
- Check if timer/interval is actually created
- Validate Work Queue connection during polling
- Ensure proper error handling and logging

IMPACT: Atlas cannot auto-process Work Queue items, requiring manual intervention for all task execution.

PRIORITY: P1 - Core Atlas functionality broken
resolution: Fixed in commit 08bd82e - startPolling() now runs immediate first cycle instead of waiting 2 minutes. Root cause: setInterval was created but no immediate cycle was run, so users had to wait 2 min to see any activity.

- No actual Work Queue polling occurs

EXPECTED BEHAVIOR:
- /worker start should initiate actual Work Queue polling
- Should check queue every 2 minutes as advertised

- Should provide real status feedback

DEBUGGING NEEDED:
- Verify polling loop implementation
- Check if timer/interval is actually created
- Validate Work Queue connection during polling
- Ensure proper error handling and logging

IMPACT: Atlas cannot auto-process Work Queue items, requiring manual intervention for all task execution.

PRIORITY: P1 - Core Atlas functionality broken

**SHIPPED:** Fixed in commit 08bd82e

Root Cause: startPolling() created setInterval but did NOT run immediate first cycle. Users had to wait 2 minutes.

Fix Applied:
1. Made startPolling() async
2. Added immediate first cycle execution
3. Added typing indicator + progress messages
4. Added logging for cycle start/completion
5. Returns first cycle result in confirmation
